adjective.description: (of a person or their behavior) unconventional and slightly strange.
examples: my favorite aunt is very eccentric

adjective.description: (of a thing) not placed centrally or not having its axis or other part placed centrally.

noun.description: A person of unconventional and slightly strange views or behavior.
examples: he enjoys a colorful reputation as an engaging eccentric

noun.description: A disc or wheel mounted eccentrically on a revolving shaft in order to transform rotation into backward-and-forward motion, e.g. a cam in an internal combustion engine.

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun denoting a circle or orbit not having the earth precisely at its center): via late Latin from Greek ekkentros, from ek out of + kentron center.
